fine_dining.name: Koka
signature_dishes: Tasting menus (3, 5, or 7 courses) focused on seasonal West Coast ingredients, particularly seafood.
fine_dining.atmosphere: Intimate, minimalist, and modern Scandinavian design
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book well in advance; specify dietary requirements when booking; wine pairings available
fine_dining.local_tips: Known for its refined take on West Swedish ingredients, especially seafood. Offers a high-quality, contemporary fine dining experience without being overly formal.

fine_dining.name: Project
signature_dishes: Tasting menu featuring creative dishes based on seasonal availability
Emphasis on balance and interesting flavor combinations (e.g., Oyster creme & caviar, Monkfish with shiitake)
fine_dining.atmosphere: Relaxed, welcoming, and stylish with an open kitchen/bar seating option
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book ahead, especially for weekends; bar seating offers interaction with the team
fine_dining.local_tips: Run by a husband-and-wife team, offers accessible yet refined tasting menus; known for its friendly atmosphere and good value for a Michelin-starred experience in Sweden.

fine_dining.name: SK Mat & Människor
signature_dishes: Tasting menus focusing on seasonal ingredients
Dishes often feature refined presentations of seafood and local produce
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant yet relaxed dining room centered around an open kitchen
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reservations recommended; good option for experiencing modern Swedish cuisine
fine_dining.local_tips: Focuses on creating a complete experience combining food, drink, and atmosphere; name translates to 'Food & People'.

fine_dining.name: Signum
signature_dishes: Multi-course tasting menu showcasing luxury seafood and seasonal ingredients from the West Coast
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant and refined setting within Hällsnäs Hotel & Restaurant, overlooking Lake Landvettersjön
fine_dining.booking_tips: Located outside central Gothenburg (Mölnlycke); book well in advance; often requires prepayment
fine_dining.local_tips: Offers a luxurious dining experience with a strong focus on high-quality seafood and local produce; scenic lakeside location adds to the experience.

casual_dining.name: Sjömagasinet
signature_dishes: Pan-fried Plaice with browned butter and horseradish
casual_dining.atmosphere: Historic warehouse setting by the water with rustic charm and maritime decor
casual_dining.reservation_needed: Highly recommended, especially for dinner or window tables
casual_dining.booking_tips: Beautiful waterfront location (Klippan); specify if you want outdoor seating in summer; known for high-quality, classic seafood preparations.
casual_dining.local_tips: A Gothenburg institution for seafood lovers, previously held a Michelin star; excellent choice for celebrating special occasions or enjoying top-notch fish and shellfish.

casual_dining.name: Fiskekrogen
signature_dishes: Classic fish dishes like Sole Meunière
casual_dining.atmosphere: Elegant yet traditional restaurant with maritime touches and a lively bar area (Fêskens Bar)
casual_dining.reservation_needed: Highly recommended, especially for the buffet
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book buffet tables well in advance; check website for specific buffet times; Fêskens Bar offers a more casual experience with smaller dishes.
casual_dining.local_tips: Another long-standing Gothenburg seafood institution; known for its quality and classic preparations; the weekend seafood buffet is very popular.

casual_dining.name: Restaurang Gabriel (in Feskekôrka)
casual_dining.atmosphere: Casual lunch spot located on the upper level inside the iconic Feskekôrka fish market hall
casual_dining.reservation_needed: Recommended, especially during peak lunch hours
casual_dining.booking_tips: Only open for lunch; offers incredibly fresh seafood sourced directly from the market below; run by a world champion oyster shucker.
casual_dining.local_tips: Iconic Gothenburg experience - eating fresh seafood inside the 'Fish Church'; note that Feskekôrka reopened in 2024 after renovations.

casual_dining.name: Familjen
signature_dishes: Often features creative takes on Swedish flavors
casual_dining.atmosphere: Lively, contemporary bistro with a neighborhood feel
casual_dining.booking_tips: Popular spot, booking advised; good for a relaxed yet quality meal.
casual_dining.local_tips: Holds a Michelin Bib Gourmand for good quality, good value cooking; focuses on West Swedish produce in a relaxed setting.

street_food.name: Halv Special / Hel Special (Various Korvkiosks)
specialties: Halv Special: Hot dog (often boiled or grilled) in a bun topped with mashed potatoes.
Hel Special: Same as Halv, but with two hot dogs.
Common toppings: Ketchup, mustard, shrimp salad (räksallad), roasted onions, pickled cucumber.
street_food.location: Various Korvkiosks (Hot Dog Stands) e.g., Oves Gatukök (Sävedalen), Mariaplans Korvkiosk, Lasse på Heden.
street_food.seating: Usually none or limited outdoor standing tables
street_food.local_tips: The quintessential Gothenburg street food. Originated in the city. Often enjoyed with a bottle of Pucko chocolate milk.

street_food.name: Strömmingsluckan
specialties: Stekt Strömming (Fried Baltic Herring) served with mashed potatoes, lingonberries, pickled cucumber, often on crispbread (knäckebröd).
street_food.hours: Lunchtime (check specific hours/location as it can vary)
street_food.location: Often near Magasinsgatan (location may vary, check social media)
street_food.local_tips: Classic Swedish street food focused on fried herring. Look for the dedicated food cart.

street_food.name: Jinx Food Truck
street_food.hours: Lunch & early evening (check social media for hours/location)
street_food.location: Often found around Magasinsgatan or other central spots
street_food.local_tips: Highly popular food truck known for its flavorful Asian-inspired buns and street food. Often has queues.

coffee_shops.name: Da Matteo (various locations)
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Hip, often bustling cafes with focus on quality coffee and baked goods. Magasinsgatan location has a popular courtyard.
coffee_shops.food_options: Excellent pastries, bread, buns, sandwiches, light lunches/pizza (Magasinsgatan)
coffee_shops.local_tips: A Gothenburg coffee institution with its own roastery and bakery. Multiple locations, each with a slightly different vibe. Magasinsgatan is a hub.

coffee_shops.name: Kafé Magasinet
coffee_shops.specialty: Coffee, Pizza, Bar in a Green Oasis
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Sprawling industrial-chic space with a stunning, plant-filled covered courtyard. Transforms from cafe to bar.
coffee_shops.best_time: Anytime (Cafe during day, Bar in evening)
coffee_shops.local_tips: Located on Tredje Långgatan. Very popular, great atmosphere day and night. The courtyard is a highlight.

coffee_shops.name: Café Husaren
coffee_shops.specialty: Classic Swedish Konditori & Giant Cinnamon Buns
must_try: Hagabulle (Giant Cinnamon Bun - enough to share!)
Other traditional Swedish cakes and pastries
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Traditional, grand cafe with high ceilings and classic decor in the heart of Haga.
coffee_shops.food_options: Extensive selection of cakes, pastries, buns, sandwiches.
coffee_shops.local_tips: Located on the main street (Haga Nygata) in the charming Haga district. Famous for its enormous cinnamon buns. A must-visit for a traditional fika experience.

coffee_shops.name: A43 Coffee
must_try: Discuss options with the knowledgeable baristas
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Modern, dedicated coffee bar focused on high-quality brews and service.
coffee_shops.local_tips: Award-winning coffee bar located on the main boulevard Avenyn. Known for its high standards and skilled baristas. Great place for serious coffee lovers.

bars.name: Stranger
bars.specialty: Classic & Creative Cocktails in a Hidden Setting
signature_drinks: Well-crafted cocktails, often with a twist
bars.atmosphere: Intimate, dimly lit, hidden basement bar with a vintage, exclusive feel (accessed via Unity Jazz)
bars.local_tips: A true speakeasy experience – find the unmarked door/ring the bell. Known for its skilled bartenders and sophisticated atmosphere.

bars.name: Bar La Lune / Bar Cento
bars.specialty: Natural & Classic Wines, French/Italian Bistro Food
signature_drinks: Extensive and well-curated wine list by the glass and bottle
bars.atmosphere: Intimate, cozy, and knowledgeable neighborhood wine bars (sister establishments)
bars.food_options: Excellent French-inspired small plates (La Lune) / Italian (Cento)
bars.reservation_needed: Highly recommended due to small size
bars.local_tips: Two highly-regarded, small wine bars near Vasaplatsen. Excellent for wine lovers looking for quality and atmosphere. Book ahead.

bars.name: Brewers Beer Bar (Tredje Lång)
bars.specialty: Swedish & International Craft Beer, Sourdough Pizza
signature_drinks: Rotating selection of craft beers on tap, focusing on local and international breweries
bars.atmosphere: Casual, lively, popular spot for beer enthusiasts
bars.reservation_needed: Not usually taken, can get crowded
bars.local_tips: Located on the bustling Tredje Långgatan. Great combination of excellent craft beer and quality pizza. Often busy.

bars.name: Steampunk Bar
bars.atmosphere: Immersive steampunk theme with elaborate decorations, gears, and gadgets
bars.local_tips: Offers a unique visual experience along with creative drinks. Located near Kungstorget. Fun for a themed night out.

food_tours.name: Gothenburg Food Walk
highlights: Sampling local Gothenburg flavors (e.g., seafood, local cheeses)
Visiting key food spots like Stora Saluhallen and possibly Feskekôrka
Learning about West Coast food culture
food_tours.booking_tips: Good overview of Gothenburg's food scene. Wear comfortable shoes. Check specific operator (e.g., Food Tours Gothenburg). Book online.

cooking_classes.name: West Coast Seafood Cooking Class
what_you_learn: Techniques for handling and cooking fresh fish and shellfish (e.g., oysters, langoustines, cod)
Classic Swedish seafood recipes and sauces
includes: Hands-on cooking, high-quality seafood ingredients, recipes, meal featuring the prepared dishes
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Can be more expensive due to ingredient costs. Look for classes offered by culinary studios or specific restaurants (availability may vary). Book well in advance.

markets.name: Stora Saluhallen
highlights: Large variety of vendors: cheese, meat, fish, bread, international delicacies, spices, olives
markets.hours: Mon-Fri approx. 9 AM - 6 PM, Sat approx. 9 AM - 4 PM
markets.local_tips: Gothenburg's main market hall. Great place for lunch, buying specialty foods, or just soaking up the atmosphere. More diverse offerings than Feskekôrka.

markets.name: Feskekôrka (Fish Church)
highlights: Fresh catch from the West Coast
Several restaurants and stalls serving seafood (incl. Restaurang Gabriel)
markets.hours: Tue-Fri approx. 10 AM - 6 PM, Sat 10 AM - 3 PM (check specific vendor/restaurant hours)
markets.best_time: Lunchtime or for buying fresh seafood
markets.local_tips: A Gothenburg landmark reopened in 2024. Primarily focused on seafood. Must-visit for experiencing the city's connection to the sea.

markets.name: Lindholmen Street Food Market
highlights: Rotating selection of food trucks and stalls
markets.hours: Weekends (Fri evening, Sat/Sun daytime - check seasonal hours)
markets.local_tips: Lively weekend gathering spot with a great variety of food options. Check their website/social media for current vendors and opening times. Accessible via the free Älvsnabben ferry.

spring: First appearances of Matjes Herring (Matjessill) towards Midsummer
summer: Kräftskiva (Crayfish Parties) - Especially prominent on the West Coast (August)
Fresh West Coast Shrimp (Färska räkor) - Enjoyed simply, often on bread (Räkmacka)
autumn: Lobster Season Premiere (Hummerpremiär) - Late September, a major event
Root Vegetables & Game Meat (similar to Stockholm)
winter: Julbord (Christmas Buffet) - With a strong emphasis on herring (sill) and salmon (lax) varieties
Oysters (Ostron) - Excellent quality during colder months
